---
category: news
title: "Interspecies research identifies important neurons for visual perception"
excerpt: "To make sense of a visual scene, it's important to be able to pick out any figures or objects from the background. In a study published recently in Frontiers in Systems Neuroscience, researchers from Japan have expanded on previous results in macaque monkeys indicating that specific neurons respond to scenes that include both figures and backgrounds."
